result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:57 PM Called 22CF44 and 22CF62 for STC and 22CF196 and 22CF210 for WOPH. Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman appeared by phone.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions def, Attny Gramstrup and State satisfied it is def on the phone.  Due to recent filings court sees today is set for WOPH, Attny Gramstrup confirms WOPH.  22CF196 and 22CF210 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over in each case.  State files information's for both cases, they mirror criminal complaints. Both cases on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of both information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of all charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts on both cases.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:14 AM Cases 22CF44, 22CF196, and 22CF62 called together.  Defendant Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Katherine Diane Lee-Boatman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person appearance KIV.  State notes def has new case- 22CF210; will proceed to initial appearance today, State serves def complaint personally in court.  Cases 22CF196 and 22CF210 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaints, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to misdemeanors, per Atty Gramstrup, def willing to waive prelim on the felonies in 22CF196.  WTLPH.  State does not request new bond, but asks bond to cover all open cases.  Atty Gramstrup to be appointed on all files.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Bond to cover Burnett County cases 22CF44, 22CF62, 22CF196, and 22CF210.  Defendant cannot leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval.  Defendant must be supervised by her son, R.B. Jr. and must reside with him.  Defendant is subject to a curfew, she must be in her house by 6 pm and cannot leave it until 6 am, except for any emergency or medical issues.   No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
